com.poesys.db.pool

Class ObjectPool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.pool.ObjectPool<T>

  • public abstract class ObjectPool<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic pool of objects that supports a minimum number of objects, a maximum number of objects, and a validation interval for an executor thread that checks those states
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService executorService
      the thread service for checking pool status
      private static org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
      Log4j logger for this class
      private static java.lang.String OBJECT_CLOSE_ERROR
      property for error message indicating an object had a problem while closing
      private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<T> pool
      the pool data structure

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectPool

        public ObjectPool(int minimum,
          int maximum,
          long interval)
        Create a ObjectPool object, specifying the settings.
        Parameters:
        minimum - the minimum number of objects in the pool
        maximum - the maximum number of objects in the pool
        interval - the interval in seconds between checks for minimum and maximum objects

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize(int minimum)
        Initialize the pool; called from constructors to share initialization processes. Sets up the pool and fills it with the specified minimum number of objects.
        Parameters:
        minimum - the number of objects to create for the initial pool

      • getObject

        public T getObject()
        Get an object from the pool, removing it from the pool.
        Returns:
        the object

      • returnObject

        public void returnObject(T object)
        Return an object to the pool, making it available for other clients. If the object is null, the pool is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to return to the pool

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws PoolShutdownException
        Shut down the pool, doing whatever is needed to close each object and shutting down the executor. Calling this method results in a non-functioning pool, so you should not use the pool anymore after calling this method.
        Throws:
        PoolShutdownException - when there is a problem shutting down the executor or a pooled object

      • size

        public int size()
        The number of objects currently in the pool.
        Returns:
        the size of the pool

      • contains

        boolean contains(T object)
        Does the pool contain the specified object? This method has package access for use in unit testing.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to test
        Returns:
        true if the object is in the pool, false if not

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a string representation of the pool.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • createObject

        protected abstract T createObject()
        Create an object. The concrete class implements this method to create objects before pooling them.
        Returns:
        the new object

      • closeObject

        protected abstract void closeObject(T object)
        Close or shut down an object. The concrete class implements this method to close objects before shutting down the pool. For example, you can close connections quietly or gracefully.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to close

      • toString

        protected abstract java.lang.String toString(T object)
        Generate a string representation for the object. The concrete class implements this as a wrapper that may call toString() on the object or implement a separate string generation algorithm if the object does not have it's own string representation.
        Parameters:
        object - the object for which to generate a string representation
        Returns:
        the string representation of the object
